questions.text: You are an Ob/gyn and your daughter who has recently entered puberty comes to you with a concern. She has been experiencing mid-cycle pain before she gets her regular periods. The most probable etiology is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mittelschmerz A female giving history of sharp pain in the lower abdomen, every month, 2 weeks before menstruation suggests Mittelschmerz as the diagnosis. Mittelschmerz is synonymous with painful ovulation. Pain is associated with rupture of ovarian follicle at the time of ovulation In most cases, mittelschmerz doesn't require medical attention.

Highyeild:

Mittelschmerz:mid cycle ovulatory pain Intermenstrual bleeding: bleeding between cycles Heavy menstrual bleeding :bleeding >80 ml , >8 days Hypomenorrhea : bleeding <20 ml / <2 days Oligomenorrhea: regular cycles at an interval of more than 35 days Polymenorrhea: regular cycles at an interval of fewer than 21 days

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Incorrect (Pathologic dysmenorrhea) Secondary dysmenorrhea is painful menstrual cramps due to a macroscopically identifiable underlying pelvic pathologic condition. It should be suspected in older women with no history of dysmenorrhea until proven otherwise. Option: C. Incorrect (Pelvic TB) Genital TB is asymptomatic or can present with a few symptoms among which infertility is the most common. Option: D. Incorrect (Endometriosis) Endometriosis is an often painful disorder in which tissue similar to the tissue that normally lines the inside of your uterus the endometrium grows outside your uterus. The most accepted theory is Sampson’s theory. It causes dysmenorrhea, menorrhagia and abdominal pain .

questions.text: A woman presents to her obstetrician with concerns that she has had trouble breastfeeding. Which of the following hormones is involved in the ejection of milk from a lactating mammary gland?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Oxytocin A combined neurogenic and hormonal reflex involving oxytocin, a posterior pituitary hormone, causes the actual ejection (“let-down”) of milk from breast tissue. The secretion of oxytocin is increased by stressful stimuli, and inhibited by alcohol. Furthermore, alcohol is transferred from the mother’s bloodstream into her breast milk and to the nursing infant, where it can have many deleterious effects.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options A and C: Although estrogen and progesterone are essential for the physical development of breast tissue during pregnancy, both hormones inhibit milk secretion. Option D: Milk secretion is regulated by prolactin, a pituitary hormone secreted throughout pregnancy and after parturition. Suckling on breast tissue is the stimulus that leads to milk secretion.

Extraedge:

SYNTHESIS AND SECRETION OF BREAST MILK Stage Description Main hormone Supportive hormones Mammogenesis Mammary Growth and Development •Estrogen (for Ductal growth) •Progesterone (For alveolar growth) • Hpl • Growth hormone • Insulin thyroxine For milk Secretion to occur Nursing effort is Not Essential Lactogenesis Initiation of Milk secretion Prolactin Estrogen Galactokinesis Ejection of milk Or let down reflex Oxytocin Suckling of Breast Galactopoiesis Mantainence of lactation Prolactin Continous suckling

questions.text: True statement out of the following about:

options.label: A
options.text: FSH and LH inhibit the release of estrogen and progesterone

options.label: B
options.text: FSH acts on granulosa cells and LH on theca cells

options.label: C
options.text: FSH stimulates estrogen while LH inhibits estrogen

options.label: D
options.text: FSH feedback inhibits the hypothalamus, while LH feedback inhibits pituitary

questions.correct_answer: B. FSH acts on granulosa cells and LH on theca cells
questions.explanation:
Solution:

FSH acts on granulosa cells and LH on theca cells Theca internal cells have many LH receptors, and LH converts cholesterol to androstenedione. The theca interna cells supply androstenedione to the granulosa cells. The granulosa cells make estradiol when provided with androgens, and it appears that the estradiol they form in primates is secreted into the follicular fluid.

questions.text: Which phase of the uterine cycle is the following endometrium in?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Proliferative phase

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options A, B, and C: the given image shows the trilaminar appearance of the It corresponds to the proliferative phase of the uterine cycle, the follicular phase of the ovarian cycle . The question asks which phase of the uterine cycle. Hence Answer is A Option D: Trilaminar appearance is not seen in the secretory phase of endometrium

Solution:

1-I, 2-II, 3-III, 4-IV

Extraedge:

Embryonic structures Homologous Female Homologous Male structure structure Genital ridge Ovary Testis Primordial germ cell Ova Spermatozoa Labioscrotal swelling Labia majora Scrotum Urogenital folds Labia minora Penile urethra Genital tubercle Clitoris Glans penis Urogenital sinus · Skene glands Bartholin · gland Lower 1/3rd of vagina(vaginal epithelium is from endoderm of UGS) · Prostate gland · cowpers gland Sex cords Granules cells Seminiferous tubules and sertoli cells Gubernaculum Round ligament Gubernaculum testis Wolffian/ mesonephric duct Gartner duct Epididymis, ejaculatory duct, ductus deference Mullerian duct/ paramesonephric Uterus, fallopian tube, cervix and Prostatic utricle and appendix of duct upper vaginal wall testis Mesonephric tubules Epoophoron and paroophoron Efferent ductless and paradidymis

questions.text: A couple who have been married for 3 years came to OPD for infertility. The sperm analysis of male comes out to be normal. The female gave a history of irregular menstrual cycles. Suspecting anovulation, the doctor called the patient on day 22 of the cycle and a sample was taken from the vagina and uterus for hormonal studies. A USG was done on the same day. what is the normal endometrial thickness that is expected on this day of the cycle?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

14mm The USG is done on day 22 of the cycle, which is the secretory phase, and during the secretory phase, the endometrial thickness is expected between 7-16mm. so option d is expected

Highyeild:

Phase Endometrial thickness Immediately after menstruation 1-2 mm (option A) Early proliferative phase 5-7 mm (option C) Secretory phase 7-16 mm (option D) Preovulatory phase up to 11 mm Postmenopausal 4 mm

questions.text: An ovulation workup was done on a female patient presenting with infertility. Match the following accordingly:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1=c, 2=e, 3=a, 4=b, 5=d 1) Endometrial biopsy for secretory endometrium- D21-23 2) Vaginal cytology - D12-14 and D21-23 3) Serum progesterone - d 21 4) Serum LH – mid-cycle daily ( D12-14 ) 5) Urinary LH for LH Surge - D12-14 Ovulation assessment- by BBT is done throughout the cycle and shows a biphasic pattern Secretory endometrium is assessed by endometrial biopsy on D21-23 Vaginal cytology- D 12-14 D 21-23 Discrete cells Folded edges. Pyknotic nuclei In clumps Background clear background dirty Serum progesterone is assessed from D8-21 ( D8 values < 1ng/ml and D -21 > 6ng/ml) Serum LH is assessed daily from D12 to 14... Ovulation occurs about 10-12hrs after LH Surge Urinary LH on Days 12-14 to look for LH Surge . The follicular measurement approaches around 20mm.

Highyeild:

1) Endometrial biopsy for secretory endometrium- D21-23 2) Vaginal cytology - D12-14 and D21-23 3) Serum progesterone - D8-21 4) Serum LH – mid-cycle daily ( D12-14 ) 5) Urinary LH for LH Surge - D12-14

options.label: B
options.text: A groove between labia minora and hymen

questions.correct_answer: B. A groove between labia minora and hymen
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A groove between labia minora and hymen Bartholin’s glands ( greater vestibular glands) are pea-sized oval glands in females that are homologous to the bulb of the penis in males. The ducts of the Bartholin gland are 2 cm long and open into the vestibule outside the hymen at the junction of t he anterior 2/3rd and posterior 1/3rd in the groove between the hymen and labium minora. The duct as well gland is lined by multi-layered columnar epithelium. But near its opening by stratified squamous epithelium (Not by transitional epithelium as is usually stated). The function of the gland is to produce abundant alkaline mucus during sexual excitement.

questions.text: Which of the following modalities has shown the best result for premenstrual syndrome?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

SSRI Premenstrual disorders: Frequently women of reproductive age experience symptoms during the late luteal phase of their menstrual cycle, and collectively these complaints are termed premenstrual syndrome (PMS) or premenstrual dysphoric disorder (PMDD) . It is mostly seen in women aged 30–45 years Choice of treatment in PMS Amongst all the drugs used-SSRI's have shown the best results. Women who meet strict criteria for diagnosis of PMS or PMDD, including socioeconomic dysfunction, are candidates for treatment with an SSRI (fluoxetine, sertraline, paroxetine, velnafexine), administered daily or only during the luteal phase. Progesterone, Estrogen & Anxiolytics can all be given but as a second line.
